Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent room”
Reviews.Author: ladyinspaing
Reviews.Content: Just a short 2 day stay with a visit to the US embassy, the embassy is only 15 minutes comfortable walk on the same street. The hotel is away from the main area of Madrid a little but quite walkable into town. Taxis are reasonable anyway so no big deal. The room is fine although should there be 2 guests there should have been 2 easy chairs, the one provided was badly stained which looked awful. The bathroom was good, a little awkward to use the shower without getting your hair wet but thats as most hotel bathrooms, its a pity the door over the bath didn't swing out so you can reach the taps without getting in the bath first. The lift is handy when you have heavy luggage, the free coffee was welcome but I had no idea until I wandered down to find some ice. There should have been a snack menu or some information about the hotel facilities in the room. The stair banisters could do with cleaning and the wooden floor is not too level so maybe some kind of warning would be good. The staff were helpful when I need some ice and directions. I wish someone would have told me they have free bikes, I read that afterwards somewhere. The free Wifi was welcome. Ok yes the bed is hard but I was so tired I hardly noticed. I thought the breakfast looked over priced so I ate out. I think the airconditioning could do with a service but it was August.

Reviews.Title: “A very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Neeraj M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property for 2 days on the 25th and the 26th june. A very nice ambience rooms were very comfortable though a little small, but the space was properly utilised. This place was very central to the nearby attractions. The staff was very courtious and helpful in everything and if you are travelling with your family and want a neat central and a safe place to stay then this is it. in our 2 days stay we could not find anything negative about this place. very nice once again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with hard beds”
Reviews.Author: fairguy
Reviews.Content: Checked in for 3 nights due to work in Madrid. This hotel is centrally located and reasonably priced. The rooms are small and adequate, with spartan desk, chair and small TV. A feature of the 'high tech' chain this hotel belongs to, is a laptop in each room with a wired network connection as well as fast and free wireless. I didn't use the laptop but it might be a nice touch for the non-business traveler. I had to switch rooms after the first night because of the hardness of the bed I slept on. A newer bed proved to be a bit softer which made the difference for me. Aside from that, the hotel is a pleasant place to stay. Breakfast is quite good and a nice touch is the free bike which I used for an outing.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Tuer
Reviews.Content: Apart from its localization itself, there's nothing special about this hotel. Room was OK, but the bed was not specially comfortable (I could actually feel the mattress springs) and the shower was very very small. There was a laptop with internet connection in my room, so that's quite convenient if you are not travelling with yours.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: MikeVanderKlok
Reviews.Content: Initially made a reservation at Suites 33 but they over-booked so I selected this hotel. Great location, very clean, attentive staff, accomodated 9 AM check-in, breakfast seemed expensive, so I declined and discovered it was a deal, small room but functional, big bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, expensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cgomezhmo
Reviews.Content: Excellent employees, Excellent location, small room. Even it was a family room it was small. The air conditioner was for whole hotel. We had from 4 nights stay 2 nights very warm and could not use air conditioner, there was none, because it has a whole hotel a/c. It should have had room air conditioning not hotel a/c. The price was expensive. Did not like much the glass walls of the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with decent services”
Reviews.Author: Varshaa
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Madrid for just a short stay, this hotel is perfectly located because it is close to everything- the airport is just 20 mins away, the Madrid Bus tour stop is a 10 min walk and the Colon Square, which is practically the juncture for a lot of activities is right next. Staff is extremely courteous and since they speak good English, it is a major plus point for English-speaking travelers. Rooms are fine- bathrooms like typical Spanish loos don't have latches (wonder why) so the preferred option is single room :P A room on each floor also has jacuzzi, so if you wish to relax and rewind, it might be a good option to opt for that room. The rooms that do not have the jacuzzi have the street view which btw, is awesome. So take your pick!! A major disappointment is the internet facility in this hotel. Despite the fact that they claim it is 48-56 mbps, the speed was worse than you would ever imagine!! The breakfast menu is fine, but it doesn't change much (we had breakfast for 3 days and the menu wasn't too different!). A word of caution for vegetarians- you will need to survive on bread and milk through out your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Right at the shopping district, but not so well maintained”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeMartin
Reviews.Content: Location is fabulous, if shopping is what you want. You can be the 1st customer out in the street and last to be off as this hotel is right in the centre of it. Near to a metro station as well. In such a location, rooms are expected to be small. And so they are. The rooms are nicely designed, but the quality of furnishings are either poor to start with, or just badly maintained. Many things looks modern in desgin, but falling apart or not functioning the way it is supposed to be. The toilet door has no lock, and in our room, it is often a bit ajar due to its poor maintenance. The drainage is also bad as the water can flow a bit out of the bathroom area. Laptop is provided, but looks abused. Table has permanent scratches and marks. So overall, good desgin, modern, but poor quality furnishing used or just badly maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Practical base for Salamanca shopping district and El Retiro”
Reviews.Author: Groombridge
Reviews.Content: Only spent one night here and did not use the restaurant either for dinner or breakfast. We had booked two standard double rooms. The beds were comfortable, the rooms spacious and the air conditioning quiet and efficient. Given the central position of the hotel it was remarkably quiet (though we were on the third floor) . The bathroom was huge and included a bath, a shower over the bath and a separate jacuzzi shower. There was a laptop with free wi-fi provided. The hotel has a rather cool and impersonal feel, but that suited us fine for a one night stay. It is based in the smart Salamanca shopping area and tourist sites (such as El Prado and the Retiro Park) are within walking distance. The front desk staff were charming and helpful, though checkout was very lengthy as a mistake had been made on the bill of the people checking out in front of us. It took 20 minutes to sort out!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing bad, but just exceedingly average!”
Reviews.Author: robski_korsikoff
Reviews.Content: I was staying in Madrid for 2 nights on business. Primary factor for choosing this hotel was it's proximity to my Company's office in Madrid. Check-in was quite swift, but was disappointed to be allocated a smoking room. Upon opening the room door, the smell of stale cigarette smoke was evident. I should have turned round, gone back downstairs and complained, but being English, and very tired after my journey, just collapsed on the bed. The room is sparsely furnished, but the bed was comfortable enough. A good size bathroom, and the best thing about the room was the 'rainforest' shower head. Limited choice of English speaking TV channels, which is disappointing for a hotel that claims to be 'high-tech'. Room includes mini-bar and safe. My room was on 5th floor overlooking the main street. But surprisingly good double glazing meant I slept very well with little disturbance from traffic noise. Air-con worked well too. Wi-fi was free and excellent connection. Breakfast buffet not the greatest. Usual cold fayre, but quite a limited selection of bread, pastries etc. Horrible coffee - like treacle! If it's included in your rate, then go for it - if not, then have a look around outside. Check-out swift. Staff always courteous and helpful. And just in case anyone wants to know, a 35 minute walk gets you to the Santiago Bernebeu! Room service menu very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location-Wished for More Help in the Front Counter”
Reviews.Author: raylaw323
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location is fantastic if you want to be close to the main sites but not in the middle of downtown Madrid. The lady at the reception desk was helpful. Our room faced the main street but was quiet if you closed your doors. The room is pleasant and modern. Good size for European standards. Internet was free with good speed. A laptop was available but I used my own. The bathroom is nice but the shower is a free standing cubicle fit for a small to medium man. If you are a little taller (over 5'10") and a little rounder (over 220 lbs.) you will find it uncomfortable. The front desk was always crowded. There was usually one person who helped with check-ins and being the bellboy which was inconvenient. This one person had to juggle many duties at times leaving customers waiting. The breakfast was good but the servers had trouble getting you espresso. One even told me that she could not get me espresso because "she was too busy." Overall a good experience but this is certainly a serve yourself type of establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant - great location”
Reviews.Author: chinchok
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant hotel.Staff were helpful. Room was clean and not tired. Looked onto back courtyard, so very quiet - though obviously no view. Wifi internet functioned fairly well. Room had its own laptop, which is a nice touch - but all business users will bring their own. Breakfast was included in the room-price and well worth taking if you do not have much time to spare in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel...”
Reviews.Author: miemiegirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Petit Palace with a media friend for a business trip in march. It is located at a very central location for shopping (just next door to Zara) and all the other awesome stores like Uterque, Loewe, Carrera y Carrera, a huge El Corte ingles etc. There is also a metro station and a bus stop service for 'hop on, hop off bus)within 5 mins walking distance. Rooms are clean and spacious for european standard although the shower cubical was rather small. Breakfast spread isn't much but very delicious..love the hams and bacon I would prefer to stay here compared to the busy are in Sol and it is a very safe area. Would definitely stay here for my next trip to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Leonorscf
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, namely for families, due to the existence of family rooms. The service, mainly at the front desk had several flaws (we hope that it was due to the vacation period).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, modern hotel in a very upscale area”
Reviews.Author: kokimonst
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a 3 night business trip, and I find it clean, comfortable, good service, nice breakfast, and quiet. The rooms are spacious, modern and comfortable, and the bathroom is quite big as well. Overall a nice place to stay. I appreciated the quiet, since I had a room facing the back and not calle Serano. Colleagues who had rooms on the other side did not hear any street noise either. Nice shops in the neighborhood along with good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Super location if you get it at a discount, but a lot of insufficiencies”
Reviews.Author: golfingaround
Reviews.Content: Great place to walk from, nice neighbourhood. Checking in friendly but very cumbersome and clumsy, internet promised but not working at all. Facilities in the room nice looking but all the high tech does not simply work (shower), if you look twice everyting is a bit rusty and overdone but not handy.... impractical!

Reviews.Title: “Okay but a bit grubby”
Reviews.Author: BowBell
Reviews.Content: Great location and cool, trendy refurbishment to older hotel. Nice design to the rooms and loved the fact that you get free internet - there is even a laptop in the room if you don't want to bring your own! The design of the room is great too, very contemporary, but the size is very small and the rooms feel a bit grubby and could do with a good clean. The other major disappointment is the bed - very uncomfortable - which was too hard and with poor quality bedding. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- average hotel”
Reviews.Author: pot28
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the PP Embessy for work and although location is fabolous, the hotel is not so fabulous. From my room I was able to hear everything in the hall, so I wouldn't say that there is a lot of privacy and my room was soooo small. The design is like any other petit palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Madridista10
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd time we stayed at this hotel, ( we were 2) at the same time of the year. We were expecting a better room and a better treatment for old customers. But instead we had a very small room, moving around the room was very difficult. Our stay was during the easter holidays, and whenever we were asking about open restaurants and shops the reception's answer would say everything is closed. But to our surprise while walking in a main shopping area in Madrid, everything turned out to be open. This was the same case for Museums. The reception was really poorly informed, and if you are new to Madrid, they would not help you in any way. The reason for coming back is mostly due to its location, but the hotel seems to lack the quality it had before.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good option for families”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeMike
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at Petit Palace Embassy this month while vacationing with my wife and 2 kids. The PP hotel chain was the only one I found in Madrid that offered a room with beds for 4 people; my kids are 8 and 11, and it was a better option than 2 separate rooms (the kids loved the bunk beds). We had a window over the courtyard rather than the street, so it was extremely quiet, which was a plus for us, though it lacked a view. Location in high end Salamanca neighborhood was ideal - quick walk to Retiro park, and we went to the La Paz food market several days instead of dining out. Staff were efficient, but not very warm. Construction on the street made hailing a cab tricky. Not a huge room, but bathroom was nice and beds were comfortable. Kids loved the laptop that came in the room for emailing friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place but a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: Elias_Casals
Reviews.Content: Madrid is a expensive city, specially if you search an area which is near the city center. This hotel is very well located in the Salamanca district (very high top class in the city and full of nice shopping streets like Serrano or Velazquez). The design of the rooms is very modern even though its quality is not the best one. The shower was not working properly, the wi-fi access in our room was non-existant but helpfully there was a computer in the room with a good cable-connection which was very useful and totally free). We did not use the restaurant for breakfast after reading some of the reports about this hotel. We did not use the bike service. People at reception were correct and fast even though not specially friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Open doors...”
Reviews.Author: Langoustine
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great in pictures, but not the same when there. There was lots of works outside the hotel, so the entry and the whole road was under construction, the day we arrived there was an unbearable smell of a very strong cleaning product that i could not bare, it eventually disappeared. My door, did not close alone, automatically, and one day i came back and my room was opened, left by the cleaner all day. When i complained to the receptionist he tried to avoid the responsibility with a very angry face, never smiled once, until i asked for the manager, who was a professional, smiling and elegant man. He offered me a better room, and was really trying hard to make me happy.They even helped me move my stuff. Not a great hotel,has everything to become one, but a great location, the park very near by is a great place to jog in the morning, and it is very close to lots of hip bars and restaurants.Ah! beds are amazingly comfortable, and the top rooms are very quiet, unless you are next to the cleaners room, where morning discussions can be really bothering if you need to sleep late.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: de049
Reviews.Content: Excellently decorated hotel (very contemporary, modern decor, especially in the rooms). Its a 4 star superior in every sense. I very highly recommend this hotel for any traveler to Madrid with or without family (i travelled with my wife and 2 year old son). Its very well located with a Metro (Tube) station at less than 100 mtr away. Easy to get to hot spot locations and good shops in the vicinity too. Don't be mistaken, everyone looks to stay on the Gran Via (Main shopping, entertainment district), but that's not a clever choice as too much happens there and it may interfere with your relaxation. This Hotel is only a few stops on Metro away from the Gran Via and is located on a very plush area of Madrid. The only BUT would be limited choice of restaurants around the Hotel. I only came across an Italian (Gino's) restaurant, albeit very nice and well priced. Just plan your dinner whilst in the citry centre, loads more choice there. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED HOTEL, plus i booked via www.booking.com and the price was a lot cheaper than a 3 star on the Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: 5fortravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family room and it was perfect for our needs. The hotel is quiet, not smoky and close to a Metro stop. Try to get the duplex room if you are traveling with kids. The staff isn't too friendly or helpful but the rooms were clean, the internet free and a good night's sleep is easy. On the other hand, the area is not in the tourist area so you can't walk out and be in the middle of things.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, not that romantic!”
Reviews.Author: DRingham
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked this hotel for us when visiting a friend living in Madrid. (Conveniently, the English language school is opposite!) Lobby and stairwell very nice, and had a very pleasant, decently sized room on the first floor. This was overlooking the main road, but very little noise. Room itself had laptop with internet (little too useful when boyfriend wants to check the football scores...), nice sized bed, wardrobe and handy safe. No tea/coffee making facilities, and very little storage space in the bathroom - designer 'bowl' sink and teeny shelf, so make up bag always inevitably full of water. Fabulous shower with nozzles all the way up the wall - useful if you don't want to wash your hair. Only real negative is that the bathroom is actually part of the bedroom, with a glass partition surrounding it. Although you couldn't see in, you could basically hear everything. I think we're past worrying about that, but this wouldn't be a 'first romantic trip abroad' hotel! The orange accessories in the room do also scream 'Easyjet'. Location fine, 1 block from tube. Area is quite upscale, so instantly wanted new chic wardrobe after seeing so many gorgeous Spaniards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Bad service”
Reviews.Author: UES
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the PPE for 4 days (Nov. 19-23). The hotel was in a great location, near all major sites and shopping. We stayed in two hotel rooms. The rooms were clean and basic (Think IKEA). Each room had a laptop with internet access which was very convenient. I agree with the previous review regarding the service at the hotel. One of the receptionists was very obnoxious and rude. She was very unpleasant and provided little help. If having web access is a must than this hotel will suit your need. If not, stay somewhere else to seek better service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Wyoming1000
Reviews.Content: Stylishly decorated hotel, small standard rooms but we got a good rate online with Opodo. Laptop in room is good but is squeezed onto the tiny table so if you wanted to do some serious work it wouldn't be very comfortable. Its very quiet, no noise of traffic, lifts or people in rooms - except for people in the corridor going back to their rooms. No bath but has an amazing Jet shower. Is fantastically placed if you're into designer shopping with every store you could possibly want located within a few streets and a short walk. Very close to the metro system. Don't bother with the hotel breakfast just round the corner is the local food market with fantastic busy, working cafes doing fresh, tasty food.

Reviews.Title: “No thanks, very Spanish”
Reviews.Author: mark28ahar
Reviews.Content: OK value for Madrid but with all the typical mistakes of Spanish hotels. No kettle to boil water in rooms, incomprehensible electrical gadgets (the aircon was probably ok but I couldnt work it out), little piles of dirt in the corners of bathrooms, abrupt receptionists with limited english who think you are trying to insult them when you are just trying to make some minor request. On the other hand the laptop in the room is great and avoids trawling around to find internet cafes. The location in an upscale neighbourhood is good if you don´t mind stepping out as a typical bleary eyed and bedragled tourist into a fashion parade. Breakfast is fine although when I ask for a black coffee for some reason they give you an expresso in a large cup rather than a normal american coffee. Overall not bad for Madrid with the provisos. For some reason they insisted I pay the whole bill in the middle of my stay when I just asked to see the account...only in Spain

Reviews.Title: “Worth Considering”
Reviews.Author: Tiredandgrumpy
Reviews.Content: We stopped at the Petit Palace for 5 nights in September and the hotel was excellent, clean rooms, free broadband internet access (theres a hotel laptop in each room, so you don´t have to mess about trying to connect your own PC to the network) and very close to the Metro. Being on one of the major roads into central Madrid meant that traffic was heavy outside the hotel, but this place is great if you a business traveller or a couple on a short break, but doesn´t really cater for children. Next time I am in Madrid, I will be stopping here again.

Reviews.Title: “Petit Palace Embassy should not be missed!”
Reviews.Author: gaudifan
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old son and I spent two nights at this hotel in late August. Honestly I booked it for its low price and had no expectations. I was shocked at how terrific this hotel was! The room was exceptional, lovely high-tech bathroom, great furnishings and the high point--the lap top with internet access. Traveling with a 13 year old this could not have been more welcome! The location was superb as well, among great shopping yest only a few minutes from the Prado. This is a hotel that should not be missed. If I return to Madrid there is no question where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Milan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel 1 August 06. A big mistake. The Hotel bar and restaurant were closed and no room service. This information was placed on a small notice in the lift - no mention of this on arrival or at booking. I was informed on checking in that the airconditioning was also not working fully..so with temperature hovering at 36 C that was no joke. Having had a long trip I decided to doze on the bed. Horror ..the sheets were filthy ..they had not been changed since the last person who had some bizarre personal habits ....Exit quick to change rooms as no maid service available. Next day there was no sign of breakfast . "A continental" breakfast was available. This consisted of a few rolls, coffee and juice for €14 !!!. Best to avoid this place..there are plenty of alternatives. The Hotel offers a plasma TV with a big choice of channels ALL in Spanish and only CNN in english. Extortion at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “great value, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 three day stays at the Petite Palace with a bus tour into Andalusia inbetween. The hotel is situated in a safe lovely residential neighborhood full of great shops, restaurants and a 15 minute walk to all the best sights- Prado museum, Thyssen collection and the lovely Retiro park-we were able to stroll through the park to and from sites, don´t miss it, it beats all those overly formal parks in Paris anyday. Two blocks from the metro which will take you anywhere. The staff was friendly and very helpful, made and cancelled reservations and assisted us in all ways needed. The room was great- spacious new bathrooms with sauna shower in the first room and a two person whirlpool bath-shower in the second! One room was on the street and the other on a large painted airshaft/couryard- both were quiet and of a size more to US standards. Breakfast was excellent, good coffee,fresh fruit and juices, pastries, salmon, eggs, yougurt and much more. A laptop and flat screen TV in each room-overall GREAT value for the price in europe. Very modern decor, normally this is not a plus to me but in this case worked very well. Paid about 150 euros-night including the breakfast after internet comparisons. Did not try the restaurant in the hotel. Avoid staying at a hotel on the Grand Via unless you like a real circus, it was better to visit than stay on.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ukrneal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from New Year's in Madrid, staying at this hotel. We loved it! It is a high tech hotel, and was recently remodeled. All the rooms we saw on our floor looked very nice, and each had different shapes (not just a cookie cutter). Since it is high tech, it has modern equipment, including a laptop with free internet in each room. The bathroom was excellent. Our room faced the inner courtyard - no view, but very quiet. We chose this hotel for its price for value. There were many hotels in the price range (100-150 Euro/night). But most had some sort of problem for us: seedy location, no internet, dark rooms, poor reviews here, etc. I am happy to report that the service was excellent and that staff really went out of their way to help, although they didn't always know things a tourist might ask. Location right near the upscale boutiques meant that it was fun to walk the area, as well as safe and quiet at night. There is a wonderful restaurant across the street too (in the Rioja club) that is open to the public. It is also 1.5 blocks away from the subway and another 5 minutes from a light rail network station (connecting the key train stations of Madrid). It was about a 15-20 minute walk to the Prado and museums there. It was probably a similar walk to the main city center (or a few subway stops). We would definitely be willing to go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Petit Palace Embassy
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Serrano 46 | (between C / Hermosilla, C / Ayala), 28001 Madrid, Spain
